programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Facing the prospect of buyer shutting down early in the year, Troy promotes Chase to captain of his own boat. Daniel Edgar calls in his son to help fill the tag quota.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Three Kennys Are Worse Than None
programme.desc: Paul's brother Barry must make sure his standards are high when he is asked to fill in for Paul and Bogart at an auction in Brampton.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy decides to bring his young nephew and protege to experience the highs and lows of an auction in South Etobicoke.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's rescue team is presented with a mammoth task when a trailer of cat food bursts into flames. Meanwhile, Bruce gets into a fight that lands him in hospital. Documentary series following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team as it patrols Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright's challenge is to capture a dangerous crocodile that has been creeping worryingly close to humans and cattle, but relocating the 16ft killer by helicopter will not be an easy task.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright and the team catch a lethal king cobra, trap a 12ft crocodile and help the rescue team dart and relocate a herd of wild elephants.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit rural Minnesota, where they meet antiques collectors and examine vintage peep show machines.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More 2018 News for You
programme.desc: An extended compilation of the most memorable news stories of 2018, with captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop, and assorted hosts and special guests from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave takes a sledgehammer to an irksome printer, and Christine Hamilton receives a gift.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Herman gives The Jug And The Other Jug a relaunch. Meanwhile, the deadly disease Woodpox is sweeping through Munty, and only Howell has the cure.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian has found the magical amulet that can potentially send him home - but it doesn't work. Howell tricks him into getting a book from the oddly menacing Munty Library.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: In the final episode, Brian joins the Munty Reserve forces, while Barbara and Steg find their own groups to enlist with.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's travels take him along the Canal Lateral a la Garonne, where he goes fishing for shad, and is invited to attend a barbecue lunch. He also investigates the produce on offer at Nerac's local market, and joins the villagers of Bruch for a snail dish.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge excursion through south-west France, visiting the city of Agen and tasting the first melon of the season in Quercy before cooking the famous Gascon dish poule au pot.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Highlights of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Daddy Day Care (2003)
programme.desc: Two unemployed executives decide to open a day-care centre, believing they have found an easy way to make a profit - but instead discover looking after a horde of rampant kids is not as simple as it seems. Family comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn and Anjelica Huston.

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Clips include an attempt to find the best bus for London's streets, and creating a dual purpose combine harvester-based snow plough.

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Host Richard Hammond shares more disastrous outcomes, including building the world's first hovercraft van and having a go at launching a Reliant Robin into space.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Intrepid gravity-fuelled Soapbox Racers take on Observatory Hill overlooking Helsinki Harbour. How will they handle the brutal berm, the car wash and the ferocious kickers?.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff tackle the Baja 1000t off-road race. On the test track, a showdown is held between a Renault hot hatch, a Porsche sports car and an old Lamborghini. Guests Laurence and Emilia Fox drop in to the studio.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. Here, a remote mountain range guards caves, holding secrets that could rewrite the history of man.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More 2018 News for You
programme.desc: An extended compilation of the most memorable news stories of 2018, with captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop, and assorted hosts and special guests from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Jenny Eclair, Johnny Vegas and Bill Bailey join regular panellist Alan Davies for an extended edition of the quiz show, in which Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he finds most interesting - regardless of whether they are correct. This time, the Stephen Fry prepares for the festive period with some seasonal merriment.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Live at the Apollo Christmas Special
programme.desc: The BAFTA nominated comedy showcase returns for its third annual Christmas special, welcoming some of the biggest and best comedic talent to the stage for some Yuletide frolics. Previous editions have featured stand-up routines and compering from renowned comedians such as Ed Byrne, Nish Kumar, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Henning Wehn. This time, Canadian comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan hosts the show, welcoming former I'm A Celebrity contestant and stand-up comic Joel Dommett, and Bristol-born comedian and radio presenter John Robins to the stage.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Elis James and Sara Pascoe join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the comedy show, looking back at events from September 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. Recorded in September 2016.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from October 2016, with former Liberal Democrats leader Tim Farron and football pundit Chris Kamara joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: VE Day: Countdown to Peace
programme.desc: This compelling documentary celebrates the approaching 75th Anniversary of freedom and peace in Europe.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.sub-title: George III and the Prince Regent
programme.desc: Tracy Borman investigates the troubled relationship between George III and his eldest son, and the impact the king's declining mental health had on the prince.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: The life of Louis XIV, revealing the unpleasant truth behind the grandeur of the Palace of Versailles, and exploring the king's love life and unusual fashion sense.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Back on the murder squad, Pat is asked to investigate when a young mother of two, Diane Leach, is abducted from a local wood. The confession of a local sex offender complicates matters, as Pat looks into the possibility that the father of a young protege of the woman may be responsible for her disappearance. Meanwhile, Walker has worries of his own, as his ex-wife Lyn is dating an abusive, unstable man, who turns into a manic-obsessive when she decides to leave him.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth disguises herself as a battered wife in an attempt to find out who is threatening the future of a women's refuge. Hetty's quest to find the leak opens her eyes to the terrifying realities of spousal abuse, and results in a gripping conclusion as she leads the women in defending their sanctuary against a violent motorcycle gang.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Acting Superintendent Amanda Prosser arrives at Sun Hill, where she makes a good impression on Jo Masters and Phil Hunter. Zain discovers Smithy is sleeping with Louise Larson, and warns him the consequences could be deadly if her husband finds out. June is forced to deal with a date-rape case on her first day back at work, while Yvonne resolves to admit she assaulted a drunk the night before - but reckons without Honey and Tony, who talk her out of it and destroy CCTV evidence of the attack.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As her trial nears, Yvonne learns the drunk she recently assaulted has been called to give evidence against her, and tearfully tells Tony she is sure the prosecution have enough evidence to put her away for a long time. Amber is paired up with Honey and sent to find the man responsible for two date-rape incidents, but puts herself at risk trying to catch the suspect and almost becomes his latest victim. Phil beats up Steve for sleeping with Kate Maltby, while Zain introduces Smithy to an informant who has had two fingers chopped off by Pete Larson, and warns he runs the risk of losing a more intimate part of his anatomy if he's not careful.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack takes a break from paperwork to help investigate a case alongside CID officers, only to discover his increasingly wayward son Ben may be the mastermind behind a major-league drugs operation. Yvonne's trial gets under way, and Laura Bryant begins work as a PC, while a sceptical Sheelagh kidnaps a youngster allegedly suffering from leukaemia, unwilling to believe there's anything wrong with her.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Yvonne finally learns her fate, and Jack Meadows continues to build a case against son Ben, but discovers to his frustration that he can only muster enough evidence to charge a comparatively insignificant drugs courier. Smithy tells Sheelagh that Gabriel raped Kerry Young, while Gina makes a bad impression on new boss Amanda Prosser by throwing a drink over a copper from Barton Street station.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry Crabbe and his wife Margaret become involved with two very different scams in the wine trade - and things fail to go according to plan. Starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: The discovery of a body sparks the reopening of a murder case Crabbe and Fisher thought they had solved 18 years previously, prompting fears they convicted the wrong man. Culinary crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry Crabbe takes on a group of conservationists who are opposed to the building of a new motorway link. Culinary drama, starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A troubled young woman's father is killed three weeks after the death of her mother, leaving the priest to console the bereaved while trying to solve a puzzling murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is unconvinced when a recently returned PoW is accused of killing his uncle, and it seems that someone will stop at nothing to keep Father Brown from the truth. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: Regina threatens Sarah's future as George's life hangs in the balance, while Anna and Gino's honeymoon is clouded by the contents of Swanson's letter.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: On returning to Ash Park, George tells the family that he is going to make an important announcement at dinner and invites James for a private chat beforehand. Gino is reluctant to face James, knowing his secret and Sarah and Rene's first moment together since their reunion is spoilt when he has another seizure and she is haunted by memories from the war. Romantic drama, starring Brett Climo and Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A death on a local farm is blamed on a Kembleford doctor through a series of poison pen letters, and Father Brown must try to find out who sent them to save his friend from the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A woman expecting her third child realises she cannot afford to care for her baby, so makes the painful decision to give it away to her wealthy but childless cousin. Shelagh befriends the woman in the next hospital bed and Dr Turner confides in Timothy about his worst fears. Sister Julienne looks for a new recruit to join the midwives, and the community prepares to celebrate the opening of a new park.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.sub-title: Audere Est Facere (To Dare Is to Do)
programme.desc: Two base jumpers die, leading Harrow into an investigation, while his daughter Fern contends with the fallout of her arrest.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Lecturer Alastair Matheson is stabbed to death in front of 30 fledgling police officers during a knife demonstration. At first it seems no more than a fatal accident in a training exercise, but when Matt, Robbie and Jackie discover that the weapon was tampered with, they find themselves faced with a murder inquiry in an all too familiar environment. Starring Alex Norton, John Michie and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A baby is found on the doorstep of businessman Jack Bellamy, who is lying dead inside. The detectives discover the victim was a serial adulterer with a string of women who could have grounds for murder, but as the rest of the team concentrates on following the leads, Robbie finds himself growing attached to the abandoned child. Drama, starring John Michie, Blythe Duff and Hugo Speer.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: In a grim turn of events, the tooth of the abducted woman is found in the debris from a wood chipper, while Walker's ex-wife's boyfriend turns psychotic.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to £10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Alex falls asleep while guarding his father's castle, allowing Sykronior to turn Kingsland into his new holiday home.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tests out Fizz's latest invention, a three-piece swimsuit to make beachgoers look chic. Magoo mistakes him for the President..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz wants to cure Magoo's near-sightedness for good. He and Weasel go over to his house, only to be taken for Magoo's parents on a surprise visit..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz writes a genius plan on a note that gets stuck to Magoo's forehead. When Weasel tries to get it back, Magoo thinks he's being pursued by spies..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike has the perfect gift idea for Iris, flowers! The only snag is that Mike discovers he's horribly allergic.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike decides to try to win Iris's affection by singing her a romantic musical number.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A day on the beach turns into a desperate struggle to catch the sun for Mr Bean.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean arranges a last-minute birthday treat for Teddy, including a morning in a toy shop and burgers for lunch. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: In Aspen, Colorado, Ben, Gwen, and Grandpa Max are on a hike to find the Forgeti.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Costly Conundrum of The Calamitous Claylossus
programme.desc: Animation. A mysterious student with secret gifts has the whole school living in fear..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave wants to learn to play the drums at school, but is given the recorder. With a talent show around the corner, Dave gets practising..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave and Fuzzypeg the dog get dirty playing at the local dump, so dirty in fact that Fuzzypeg picks up an extremely grumpy flea..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In England's first National Park, the Peak District, James is joined by restaurateur Tessa Bramley, who serves him a beef fillet alongside vegetables from her own garden. He also takes part in an unusual contest - hen racing - where he challenges a local lad and world champion to a race. After discovering some award-winning gin, James meets a local forager and samples some of his elderflower wine. Finally, he uses some of the foraged elderflowers to make a delicious dessert.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Granada in southern Spain, where he learns about the famous Alhambra Palace, enjoys a lesson in flamenco dancing and visits the caves of Sacromante, home to a cooking school where he is taught to make classic tortilla and fried aubergines. Ainsley also samples Spanish hot chocolate - thick, creamy and flavoured with orange - and tries local delicacy piononos, with tour guide Katia. Along the way, he rustles up chicken with saffron potatoes and a classic seafood paella.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are joined by Levi Roots,who prepares BBQ salmon, Nadia Sawalha, who makes Mexican chicken, and Shelina Permalloo, who demonstrates a banana and caramel dessert. Plus, recipes for slow-cooked steak chilli, salsa and guacamole, dairy-free coleslaw and a chocolate cake in a mug.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A prestigious golf club is the setting for murder when a player is bludgeoned to death on the 13th hole. Barnaby and Jones discover gambling, illegal money-lending and assault are rife among the snobbish members, who are also dismissive of the local villagers and only allow them on the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another body turns up, making the detectives doubly determined to catch this terror of the fairways. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with guest appearances by Nicholas Le Prevost, John Standing and real-life golfer Sam Torrance.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Coventry, Warwickshire. Alison Chapman collides with a Scalextric car, Henry Nicholls has a laugh with Laurel and Hardy and David Ford tries to lasso a Wild West artefact.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hits the road one last time for the concluding installment in this second series of the open-air game show. Once again, Stephen is hitting the streets in a city somewhere in the UK, and setting the members of the public he meets along the way a succession of unusual challenges. Success in these games could give the contestants a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to a £1000 cash prize in the big finale game. This week, Stephen's final destination is Belfast.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as TV presenters Donna Air, Amanda Lamb, Sarah Greene and Dan Snow pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson returns with another series of the big-prize quiz, broadcast over six consecutive evenings this week. Six contestants are ready and waiting for the fastest finger first question, hoping to win a place opposite Jeremy and the chance to answer the 15 questions that could change their lives. If they get stuck, they always have the lifelines Ask the Audience, 50-50, Ask the Host and Phone a Friend available to them - and if they're lucky, like Charlotte Church in last month's celebrity show, one of their friends might just happen to be one of the Chasers.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: Marc Warren steps into the shoes of Barry Foster to take on the role of Dutch detective Van der Valk in this updated adaptation of the Amsterdam-based crime drama.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: The making of the drama series, produced by Oscar-nominated writer Jeff Pope, which saw the actors working in isolation, with help from their family members.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Alone, heavily pregnant and fed up with life, Mel faces having to go through the birth of her first child without the married father of her baby, who has chosen to stay with his wife and family. She is without even her own family, who have given her the cold shoulder. Sheridan Smith stars in first of four short dramas depicting life in lockdown during the Sheridan Smith stars in first of four short dramas depicting life in lockdown during the coronavirus pandemic.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Ex-convict Russell is far from happy to be isolated with his father Ron, who believes he has brought shame on the family. As Ron succumbs to the virus, Russell must put their differences aside to keep his spirits up. Starring Robert and Tom Glenister.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Four short dramas depicting life in lockdown. The worst fears of paranoid, self-absorbed hypochondriac Mike have come true. There is an unstoppable virus that affects us all, and he can catch it just by breathing the same air as other people. As he struggles to cope with his fears during the Covid-19 outbreak, he insists on an online session with his old friend and therapist, Rochelle.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: A grandad stops off outside his grandkids' window every day to mess about and make them smile. But his son-in-law, still hurting after being left by his wife, does not welcome these daily visits. David Threlfall and Eddie Marsan star in this one-off drama, which also features Eddie's children Blu and Bodhi.

programme.title: Euro 96: The Summer Football Came Home
programme.desc: A look back at the tournament, which was staged in England and saw the hosts enjoy a memorable run to the semi-finals. Highlights on the field included Paul Gascoigne's individual brilliance against Scotland, Stuart Pearce's moment of redemption against Spain and the all-round excellence of England's demolition of the Dutch. With contributions from Terry Venables, Stuart Pearce, David Seaman and Teddy Sheringham.

programme.title: Zara Larsson's Hot Hook-Ups
programme.desc: Swedish Pop powerhouse Zara Larsson gets pretty passionate about RiRi and Queen B, and reminisces about hooking up with the monster in her 'Never Forget You' music video..

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: George and Scott are convinced there is a potential $1.5million of gold to be mined on their claim, but wonder if their neighbours will allow them to get it out of the ground.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson investigates rumours of secret underground escape route used by infamous gangster Al Capone. Plus, mysterious earthen mounds in Washington State.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr and Vinnie venture into enemy territory to pick up the Black Widow bike, while Paul Sr is frustrated he has not seen Mikey since the settlement.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: Five of the world's most impressive cranes are pitted against one another in a variety of key categories.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe experiences work in the steel industry when he visits a mill in St Louis.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The documentary exploring the manufacturing processes behind everyday objects returns, turning attention to leather basketballs, wood panel canvases and shoelaces.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are placed under the microscope, as the manufacturing processes behind the production of Asian bowls and walking canes are detailed.

programme.title: Robson Green's Australian Adventure
programme.desc: The actor's antipodean tour concludes in Queensland, where he goes 'off the grid' to find out what life is like away from the state's popular beaches.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to South Carolina, where they come across a mammoth collection of militaria that includes Civil War revolvers and even Forrest Gump's original footlocker.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland take on their biggest restoration yet, a VW Beetle Karmann Cabriolet. The car is in terrible condition, but Drew is determined to save it from the scrapheap.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike takes on a Porsche 924, the first car he ever turned around on the series, but oil leaks and a worn interior may not be enough to earn a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to grab a genuine junior supercar, but when he arrives back in the UK, expert technician Edd China realises that extensive work needs doing.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John take a road trip in Hungary. In Budapest, they visit one of the country's biggest antique markets. Later, they unearth treasures in a former communist factory.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers save a quirky counter, a 100-piece chandelier and a vintage football table. Plus, a 100-year-old shop counter is rescued from a bonfire.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: A fancy fairground waltzer, an ancient coffee machine and a huge oak table are restored in the workshops of some of the UK's most celebrated crafts people.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revamp a fragile standing mirror needing some love, a classic armchair and a large railway station clock. Rebecca Pritchard examines their origins.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Artisan restorers Alex Webster, Craig Hughes and Carl Bouverie-Brine work on renovating a fold-out mirror, a classic armchair and a large railway clock.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Skilled craftspeople are bringing Drew Pritchard's finds back to life. With demanding customers and high turnover, their hard work turns trash to treasure purple.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Arnold brings Dan two related projects. He wants the team to transform his 1946 Ford Wagon into a classic tour-mobile, and fix the motorcycle that will ride in the back.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to South Carolina, where they come across a mammoth collection of militaria that includes Civil War revolvers and even Forrest Gump's original footlocker.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a toy fire engine, a Japanese Imari bowl that has been smashed to bits, and a unique village sign from Dorset.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Sussex, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard has some incredible luck when he is offered first pick of a shop packed full of French items. Then in Kent, he's invited behind the scenes of a historic railway.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland take on their biggest restoration yet, a VW Beetle Karmann Cabriolet. The car is in terrible condition, but Drew is determined to save it from the scrapheap.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, a community centre is crushed. Plus, in Berkshire a scrap artist works on a challenging new piece and in Coventry car parts are repurposed.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Leading to one of the richest finds in Darrell's career, the team discovers ornate artefacts that indicate the location of a 16th century captain's quarters.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Gold miner Farley aims to save his family business in the deadly jungle - but a frustrated crew, suspicious tribal chiefs and unforgiving river threaten the mission. The boat crew discovers that a crucial miscalculation may have damaged the dredge beyond repair, while the Americans chase their first taste of Bougainville gold.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How technology such as mobile phones, CCTV and cashpoints can help solve murder investigations.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Twenty-four-year old Nathan Trapuzzano is shot dead during his morning walk, leaving his pregnant wife a widow. Can CCTV footage help police track down the killer?.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The New Year's Eve 2000 murders of Carl and JoAnna Dutcher and their 15-year-old grandson Tony, in the tiny Rocky Mountain outpost of Guffey. It transpired a school friend of Tony's, Scott Grimes, committed the act because he felt pressured by an older peer group with which he was associated.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A courier's burning body is found in an alley and officers uncover a crime ring run by a violent drug baron who intimidated his men into silence.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Boris the boar has been abandoned without food or water in disgusting conditions. The race is on to free him and give him a better life.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a tiger with toothache and checks on some puppies that will be trained into guide dogs. Meanwhile, Lisa battles to save a much-loved Pomeranian.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown delivers a litter of 10 assistance-dog puppies and helps a kitten in a critical condition after a freak accident. Plus, a snake is seriously injured.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Three brides search for the perfect dress, including Elona, who has recently overcome huge obstacles, and Courtney, who brings along her mother to help.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.sub-title: Big Bridal Bumps in the Road
programme.desc: Heather's wedding is taking place on the Love Boat and her dress needs to include feathers. Plus, Marissa encounters a challenge during her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride has dreamed about walking down the aisle in a dress with a detachable shirt since she was a little girl, and it falls to the team to make it happen.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a tiger with toothache and checks on some puppies that will be trained into guide dogs. Meanwhile, Lisa battles to save a much-loved Pomeranian.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown delivers a litter of 10 assistance-dog puppies and helps a kitten in a critical condition after a freak accident. Plus, a snake is seriously injured.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown helps celebrity bull Bully, whose horn is growing into its head, and it is discovered that turtles are starving off the coast of Cairns.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A five-week-old puppy is struggling to walk, a cat and a snake are brought into the clinic after having a fierce fight and a water dragon causes mayhem.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Since his mum's death, Aaron's lived at home to care for his elderly father. However, his food addiction could send him to an early grave unless he gets weight-loss surgery.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A medical emergency threatens Pauline's weight loss progress, and Chay's life takes a dramatic new direction.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Bradyn Fuksa, who vanished in July 2009 after taking a mysterious 10-hour journey from Kansas to Wyoming before abandoning his vehicle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole has flown in on a private jet with her family to go shopping at the salon - and money is no object in the search for a couture gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Featuring Sarah, a plus-size bride who has tried on nearly 20 unsatisfactory dresses, and Sofia, who wants to lose more than a stone for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Brooke tells Dianne and Randy that her budget is $7,000, leading to an awkward conversation when her mother reveals it is actually $4,000

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pageant queen Kristi searches for a dress that will keep all eyes on her, while there is a surprise in store for wannabe bride Sarah.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amanda finds a dress that tops the one she has already purchased at another shop, while consultant Keasha helps Brooke become a Kleinfeld bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Daisy tries on a dress that is twice her budget, while Donna is overwhelmed by her father's generosity.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah and Diane help find matching dresses for two brides marrying each other, while Amy returns for her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli helps find a dress for Lauren that will also get her opinionated family's approval, while Sharon discovers an unexpected bargain.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa decides to head to the gym, but a spirit interferes with her work out. Later, she breaks down during a particularly emotional reading.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo takes her sick dog to the vet for a medium inspired assessment when she finds communicating with him difficult.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo and her family help at a soup kitchen during the Christmas holidays. However, when an alleged spirit interrupts, a sceptic is left in shock.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Victoria tries to use her charm to get a car from her parents. Her mother is against the idea, but her father is ambivalent. Theresa also helps a woman reconnect with her father.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Cameras observe the model, businesswoman and celebrity's life in an access-all-areas pass into her relationships with family and friends, at work and at play.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Profile of Moors murderer Myra Hindley who, along with her partner Ian Brady, abducted and killed five children during the 1960s. Featuring contributions from the relatives of her victims as well as criminal psychologists, who discuss whether she was innately evil or an impressionable woman under the power of a perverted man.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy decides to have a real wedding ceremony in case she doesn't survive surgery. Later, the sisters head to Atlanta hoping for a life-changing final weigh-in.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The medic considers the case of a 42-year-old waiter who collapsed and died while leaving the restaurant where he worked. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her bathroom floor.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The disturbing methods of female killers, who often take a less violent approach to murder than their male counterparts but can prove just as ruthless.
